Mako guided the group to the place where he witnessed the Equalists take off with his brother prior to the Revelation rally, and Lin used her seismic abilities to locate a nearby entrance to the underground network.

Discreetely following two Equalist bikers, the group infiltrated the Equalist base. paragraphs.text: When the foursome resurfaced to meet the arrival of the United Forces, they witnessed their swift defeat at the deployment of the Equalist biplanes. Korra managed to rescue General Iroh and brought him down to the large underground chamber to heal his wounds. There, Iroh requested Gommu's help to send a message to Commander Bumi, something the former telegraph operator was glad to do.

paragraphs.body: General Iroh proceeded to forge his plan to ground the Equalist airplanes in order to give Bumi's fleet a fighting chance. As the group of five was about to leave, Korra announced that she had her own battle to fight, namely taking down Amon on her own terms. At this decision, the group split in two, each leaving through a separate tunnel to complete their own mission.

paragraphs.body: Upon first glance, Republic City's underground tunnel system seems to be largely unused. However, due to growing ${link_0} among the citizens of Republic City, it has been the primary base of operations for Equalist activity.

paragraphs.body: The tunnels themselves were formerly used by Equalists as tracks for their vehicles, particularly cargo trucks and motorcycles. Secret doors and entrances are located throughout the network, rigged to open following the flick of a switch. These passages lead directly to junctions where Equalist weaponry and equipment were stationed.
